entry.title: SAP S4HANA public Cloud System Landscape
entry.content:
SAP S4HANA public Cloud System Landscape

Set Up the System in:
                                        2-System Landscape
                                        3-System Landscape

3-System Landscape
The 3-system landscape consists of a development system     ,   test system, and production system
Configuration content in the 3-system landscape is always provided via
 SAP Central Business Configuration, which is connected only to the development system ,
While SAP handles the software updates and upgrades
you decide within a dedicated time frame when you want to apply the content updates and upgrades available in SAP Central Business Configuration

 

Development system
The development system provides a safe environment for development projects that include advanced coding projects.
The development system is divided up into two tenants with specific purposes:
 the customizing tenant and the development tenant.

Customizing tenant: In the customizing tenant, you can do the following:
.Configuration activities based on the reference content from SAP Central Business Configuration
.Create low-code custom developments in key user apps

Development tenant: The development tenant provides access to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud ABAP Environment
. In this environment, you can build your own custom developments based on lifecycle-stable SAP objects.

Test system
Once you've finalized your development and configuration projects in the development system, you can transport them to the test system. In the test system, you can test both your custom developments and configurations before forwarding them to the production system.
Production system
The production system is the system in which you work productively with the developments that you created and the content that you configured in the development system and tested in the test system.

 

 

2-System Landscape

The 2-system landscape consists of a quality system and a production system.
SAP is responsible for both the software and content updates and upgrades.

Quality system
The quality system combines development, configuration, and testing activities. You can test your custom developments and configurations separately in the quality system before transporting them to the production system.

In particular, you can do the following in the quality system:
.Configure your content in your configuration environment.
.Create low-code custom developments in key user apps.

Production system
The production system is the system in which you work productively with the content provided by SAP and your custom developments from the quality system.

 

Key Concepts and Apps

Familiarize yourself with key concepts, terminology, and apps in identity and access management. Depending on the types of tasks you perform, some of these concepts may not apply to you.

Workforce Management
Manage workforce that includes both employees and contingent workers in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, a business user can only be created when the corresponding worker already exists.

Identity and Access Management
Identity and Access Management (IAM) enables you to control user access to apps and specify what business users can do and see in the apps.

Scoping
Identity and access management (IAM) artefacts are displayed in the IAM apps if they are in scope.

Transport Management for Identity and Access Management Artefacts
Get an overview of identity and access management (IAM) artefacts that you can transport from your development system to your test system and then forward to your production system. Also learn about the best practices that we recommend for managing these transports.

Security Recommendations
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is delivered with secure default configurations wherever this is possible. However, you might want to review some settings and adjust them to your particular use case and corporate policies. A typical example is user and authorization management.

Authentication
Every SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition instance uses SAP Cloud Identity Services - Identity Authentication as identity provider (IdP). You can either use Identity Authentication natively as the source of user identities or you can use a proxy setup to connect an existing corporate IdP.

entry.title: Use of Business Area in Enterprise Architecture
entry.content:
Hello,

My Indian client has a specific requirement for state-wise and product-wise financial reporting of their business. In their previous SAP ERP system, Business Area was used to represent geographical dimensions of financial transactions, while Profit Center was leveraged for business segment reporting. However, in the S/4HANA environment, the client is encountering challenges due to ambiguity regarding the continued support and appropriate use of Business Area for capturing geographical dimensions in financial reporting. When they did the migration, the I.P. did not recommend using business area due to the ambiguity mentioned above.

We have considered alternative approaches, including creating location-based Profit Centers and using Segment to capture the business dimension. However, since standard SAP financial reports (e.g., Trial Balance) are not available at the Profit Center Group level, this solution does not fully meet the reporting requirements.

Appreciate if someone could advise on the recommended approach in S/4HANA for capturing and reporting on the geographical dimension of financial transactions? Specifically, we are looking for SAP-recommended objects or design practices that would enable accurate and efficient state-wise reporting along with business segment wise reporting.

Your guidance on this matter would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Re: Session 1 Recap & Highlights‚Äì Data Inspired ‚Äì Successful concepts for data-driven organizati
entry.content:
Sebastien's presentation was very good. I left a comment on his LinkedIn post and thought I would also share my thoughts here:

I‚Äôve been lucky enough to work with executive committees on strategic planning a few times. At this level the discussions are highly data driven. In fact, the preparation work is a huge amount of data gathering, reviewing, formatting. This includes internal and external data. The two main challenges I see are:

Internal data isn‚Äôt available: something wasn‚Äôt captured during transaction execution e.g. a specific dimension related to customers.

External data isn‚Äôt available: the biggest challenge is accessing competitor data

Data is available, but it‚Äôs not strong enough to either confirm or disprove the bias of the executive committee members. Senior leaders tend to have bias from their previous roles which sometimes leads to wins, sometimes not.

For strategic planning the concept of ‚Äòdata exploration‚Äô is key. It's essentially a number of deliberations about what to do: invest in existing products, launch new products, enter new geographies, make acquisitions, cut costs etc. To discuss these, and make optimal decisions we need a lot of data.

The more we can empower an executive committee with data, the better.

Shifting from the executive level down into the organisation I think data is less utilised in decision making. As you were presenting I was wondering ‚Äòwhy?‚Äô

I do think your insight ‚Äúempower people‚Äù is great. We need data available at all levels in all situations, not just dashboards at the executive level.

Looking at the top 3 obstacles being the same across the last decade. I had a few observations:

‚ÄúNot enough management attention‚Äù

Could this be a ‚Äòmiddle management‚Äô issue. I‚Äôve often seen that the executive level is highly pro data and they do sponsor projects. However, those projects often go in the wrong direction (wrong approach, wrong systems, wrong people..). I think there is a gap somewhere between executives and skilled data scientists where middle management are making poor decisions on software, architecture etc. So regardless of attention there transformation into results is poor. There are probably a number of key roles that can help to fix this.

"Lack of skills"

I see a few problems here:

  • Speed of evolution of technology (it‚Äôs hard to keep up with new data products)
  • Silo‚Äôs across the end to end processes.

On the topic of silo‚Äôs I‚Äôve seen data and analytics teams set up almost like ‚Äòmega projects‚Äô or ‚Äòseparate functions‚Äô. When I‚Äôve meet with them to discuss finance data I‚Äôve been shocked at their lack of understanding of the source transactions. They don‚Äôt understand what a double entry is, they don‚Äôt understand what a legal entity, account or profit center is. To work with this data, you need to understand it. They do know data systems and data modelling, but they lack both business context and ERP or data source technical context. Of course, this isn‚Äôt meant as a criticism solely on those teams. On the other side the functional teams lack data analytics knowledge.

My two personal interventions would be:

  • Ensure we have highly skilled mid management to connect executive desires on data to the right projects on the ground
  • Break down the silos, start a knowledge building initiative to train the organisation on end to end data meaning, from the posting of a transction and what that actually means through to the decision making proces.

In terms of data culture. I think back to working with organisation on improving effectiveness. ‚ÄòLean‚Äô is a propular way to do this. But Lean only works if you embed it as a culture. Not a set of tools. The main concept with Lean is that even the lowest level person in the organisation can stop a broken process and raise a continuous improvement request. I do agree this is probably similar with data. Only when all levels understand and utilise data in their day to day work will a company reach those benefits you shared on slide 1.

entry.title: Re: Error connecting SAP Analytics Cloud to S4Hana Cloud...
entry.content:
Hello @s0025801152 

Based on your screenshots, the issue is likely due to a missing configuration in your Communication System (SAC_DEV),

  1. Outbound OAuth 2.0 Client Settings are empty ‚Äì these must be maintained for SAC to authenticate via SAML Bearer Assertion.
  2. No outbound user is assigned; you need to define a communication user and assign it under Users for Outbound Communication.
  3. Trust and OAuth setup ‚Äì make sure the SAC signing certificate is correctly uploaded to Maintain Certificate Trust, and that the OAuth token endpoint and audience are maintained in both SAC and S/4HANA.

Also, verify that SAP_COM_0055 is active and points to the correct communication system with the required authentication method

Once all configs are in place, re-test your Live Connection in SAC:

  • Go to Connections ‚Üí Add Live Data Connection ‚Üí SAP S/4HANA Cloud
  • Ensure host, OAuth settings, and certificate match exactly as expected.

References:

  • SAP Help: Setting Up Live Connection to S/4HANA Cloud
  • SAP Learning: Creating Live Data Connections to Cloud Applications
  • SAP Note 2531811 ‚Äì Live Data Connection to SAP S/4HANA Cloud using OAuth
  • SAP Note 2482622 ‚Äì How to set up the OAuth 2.0 SAML Bearer flow

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.content:
Machine translation:

Whether fixed asset cards can support multiple languages

Overseas companies of Chinese companies are in Spanish. Fixed asset cards support bilingualism, asset information is displayed in Chinese when logging in in Chinese, and asset information is displayed in Western language when logging in in Western language. Testing is currently not possible in SAP Public Cloud ES 2502.

First create the asset card in the Chinese environment, and when switching to the Western language, the asset description is also Chinese. In a Western-language environment, the asset description is shown in Western + Chinese when switching to Chinese by prepending the description of the asset with the addition of the Western language.

entry.title: Re: DME file splitting based on amount threshold
entry.content:

entry.title: Re: Technical wagetype config
entry.content:
It is possible to add 3 Wage Types into a single one by using Custom Cumulators /190 to /193, or since you only have 3 WTs to add together you can use PCRs (example: PCR ZABS could be used to read WTs 0101, 0135 and 0198 and for each of them use Operations ADDWT Z101 followed by ADDWT *

Next, if you want your Technical WT (or what I would call an Information WT) to appear in RT, you have to make sure that it will be transferred to RT at the end of a schema after it has been created (there are 3 or 4 Processing Classes that enable that).  For one employee, execute a Payroll Simulation with the "Display Log" box checked, and drill down into the Log to confirm that your WT (Z101) is created correctly, and follow it into the Log until one of the Standard PCRs where some WTs are  transfered to RT and CRT according to the WT"s value of the relevant Processing Class.

entry.title: Re: Post Outgoing Payment Notification
entry.content:
Hello @adnanmaqbool 

The Post Outgoing Payment app (F0708) does not support flexible workflow or built-in approvals in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Possible options to consider:

  • Custom BAdI: Check if FI_OUTGOING_PAYMENT_VALIDATION is available in your system via the Custom Logic app to implement validations.
  • Authorisation Controls: Limit access or enforce segregation via business roles.
  • Payment Requests App: Supports workflow but has known limitations with cross-company and card payments.

Currently, there‚Äôs no standard approval flow for this app. You might consider submitting a feature request via the Customer Influence Portal.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Manage Allocations (F3338) ‚Äì Filter WBS Elements by Profit Center (SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2502)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm working on setting up a cost allocation cycle using the "Manage Allocations" app (F3338) in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2502, with the following context:

  • Allocation context: Cost Center

  • Allocation type: Overhead Allocation

  • Sender: A single Cost Center

  • Receivers: All WBS Elements belonging to a specific Profit Center

  • Allocation type: Using secondary cost element

I‚Äôve tried using the "Manage Global Hierarchies" app (F2918) to create a custom hierarchy of WBS elements that I could reference within the allocation segment. While technically feasible, this approach requires manual maintenance of the hierarchy, which becomes unsustainable over time as projects and WBS elements are frequently updated.

I'm therefore looking for a more dynamic solution: Is there any way to filter WBS elements by Profit Center directly within the allocation cycle definition? Alternatively, are there any best practices or workarounds‚Äîsuch as derived hierarchies, tagging mechanisms, or the use of custom fields‚Äîthat could help achieve this requirement more efficiently?

Any help or insight from others working in similar cost allocation setups would be appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: SAP Continuous Integration and Delivery for SAP Integration Suite Artifacts

entry.title: Re: out of samples
entry.content:
The BTP trial account is free, but it's not unlimited.

Under the entitlements page you can see the restrictions (maybe it's the same page you were already). Some restrictions (like quota) are applied on the space level (quota) and some others are applied either on the global account or subaccount level (entitlements). 

Some limitations you can bypass by creating another subaccount under your trial (for instance, having 1 BAS subscription on each subaccount to be able to have more than 2 dev spaces). However some others you cannot bypass as all trial subaccounts are under the same global account which such restrictions you cannot control.

PS: that is a valid question for the Technology Topic, it is not a good fit for the Coffee Corner IMHO.

entry.title: Re: Storage Bin field not appearing in Plant data/Storage...
entry.content:
Hello @NageshaMC 

The Storage Bin field in the Plant Data/Storage 1 view appears only when the material is extended to a storage location managed by EWM (i.e., with a warehouse number assigned).

Technically,

  • Field LGPLA (Storage Bin) is part of EWM-managed storage location logic.
  • In Inventory Management (IM), storage bins are not used, so the field stays hidden.
  • This behaviour is not driven by material type, but by plant/storage location config.

What to check:

  • Use SSCUI 102407 or config app to verify:
    • Storage location is assigned to a warehouse number
    • The warehouse is EWM-enabled for the plant

If not using EWM, the field won‚Äôt appear by design.

Warehouse Management-SAP Help

Manage Product Master

Let me know if you need further assistance

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: PO amendment
entry.content:
Hello @NageshaMC 

A flexible workflow does not explicitly indicate if a PO approval is an initial or change-triggered re-approval in S4 Public cloud

Possible Technical options:

1. Workflow Log (My Inbox)

    • Use the workflow trace to check if the workflow was restarted due to a change (e.g. quantity update).
    • Each instance is logged but not labelled as ‚Äúre-approval.‚Äù

2.PO Change History

    • In Manage Purchase Orders, use Display Changes to view which fields triggered re-approval.

3.Custom Logic (BAdI: MM_PUR_S4_PO_WFL_APPROVER)

    • Implement logic to set a flag or update a custom field (ApprovalCyte cle) when the workflow is restarted.

There‚Äôs no standard indicator, but the combination of workflow logs + change history gives a reliable audit trail.

Maintaining Purchasing Data in Mat. Master Record-SAP Help

Simple Flexible Workflow event never triggered for PO

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAP Joule - Identity Provisioning - No assigned Roles...
entry.content:
Hello @Tobias_Metz 

Hi Tobias,

You're seeing roles provisioned, but no apps/pages appear in SAP Build Work Zone (Joule), and Site Manager, Channel Manager shows 0/0 created. This happens because the catalogues and pages in S/4HANA Cloud are not exposed to FLP.

Possible technical options

1. In S/4HANA Cloud, open the Manage Launchpad Content app.

2. For each catalogue, space, or page used in the roles, enable:

 ‚ÄúExpose to SAP Build Work Zone‚Äù (sets FLP: Expose = true)

Re-run the Identity Provisioning job from S/4HANA - BTP.

3. In Work Zone Site Manager, go to Content Explorer ‚Äî you should now see roles, catalogues, and pages properly synced.

4. Roles alone are not enough. Only content with FLP: Expose = true will sync to the Build Work Zone.

 Check below SAP Documentations

 SAP Help ‚Äì Expose Launchpad Content to SAP Build Work Zone

Expose Federation Content from SAP S/4HANA-SAP Learning

Exposing Content from SAP S/4HANA-SAP Learning

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Story Report Output Issue
entry.content:
Hi @Punita ,

When you add the field 'Performance rating' to the data source and preview the query, you will see decimal values. However, when exporting this field through XLS, all users will see these decimal values. On the other hand, when exporting through CSV, some users might see values without decimal places. This discrepancy is due to how Excel handles CSV files.

If you try to open csv file in note pad ++ every user can see decimal values for this field

If the field doesn't contain values like Too New to Rate and unrated then you can see calculation like below to fetch only Numerical value.

SUBSTRING( [Performance Management#Competency#Competency Official Rating]  ,0 , LOCATE( [Performance Management#Competency#Competency Official Rating] ,"." ,1 )-1 )

Regards

Subbu

entry.title: Re: Unable to Connect SAP Business Application Studio to...
entry.content:
Hello @HuyNguyen1 
I believe there are two potential causes for this issue:

1. Invalid Landscape URL The landscape URL you provided may be incorrect or inaccessible. Please verify that you can open it manually in your browser. Landscape URLs typically follow this format: https://<account.domain>/index.html. When registering a new landscape in the "BAS Desktop Client," you should enter only the base URL: https://<account.domain> (excluding any specific path).

2. Multiple VSCode Instances This issue can occur when you have several VSCode instances running simultaneously. To resolve this, you can either:

  • Close all other VSCode instances and keep only the one you want to authenticate with, or
  • Ensure that the VSCode instance that initiated the authentication process remains active and focused.

I hope this helps resolve your issue.

entry.title: Re: Can SAC work like power pivot from Excel?
entry.content:
@quincycheng1992 SAC and Power pivot /BI behaves a bit different. The data model in power pivot lets you create the join between the tables while defining the data model and also define the filter direction. SAC just allows for blending and filtering of data using the common linked dimension. What you could try is adding the linked dimension to the filter section of the chart if its being forced for rendering.

 

Hope this helps !!

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: SAP HANA Studio: Error while exporting tables and calculation views
entry.content:
If you want to export to other instances, you need to export this table using sql like: EXPORT EXPORT_TABLE_XXX ...'  (This is not to export to another table, this is to export this table to a directory). 
And if this table is larger than 2GB, then it cannot be exported to local client.
It has to be exported to Cloud storages or via Data Lake. Then import to another instance.

But if you really need it locally than you have only one option left to break the table into pieces and move data in batches. you can acheive that by creating a table using "like" then moving some data, than export that than truncate the table than insert and export next batch and so on...

entry.title: Re: BAPI_CHARACT_CREATE shows success, but the characteri...
entry.content:
Update: This question has been resolved and is now marked as closed.

I found a way to make it work by running the BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT using Test Sequences in SE37, the characteristic gets saved properly and becomes visible in CT04.

So, if you're facing the same issue:

Use Test Sequences to call BAPI_CHARACT_CREATE, followed by BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT

This ensures that the transaction is finalised, and the characteristic is immediately active without ECM-related issues.

Thanks to everyone who viewed the post!

My client is migrating from the Former Budget to Budget Control System.

Today, at Former Budget Profile there is an availability control that checks that the total release budget at ‚Äúson" commitment items equal or lower than the release budget at "father" commitment item. Standard error BQ111 display when this condition is not met.

What is the preferred / standard way to reproduce this availability control at FM BCS ?

I try to check the following direction:

  1. BCS AVC Budget to Budget Ledger ‚Äì I didn't find a way to distinguish "fathers" release budget from "sons" release budget as there is no way to filter release budget type at AVC ledger consumable budget.
  2. Consistency check - requires developing Z key figures that sums "sons" total release budget.
  3. Badi FMKU_BUDGET_EVENT - develop the required check from scratch.

Thanks,
Amit Blumshtein

entry.title: Event driven architecture Postman to Solace: Event Publishing Using SAP CPI : part-4
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community!

In this blog i would like to share the implementation of publisher part of my use case Event driven architecture using solace Event broker.

Step-1 : Setup a postman :

Use the method POST and use the SAP cpi endpoint in the url section  and hit with the target payload that i am given below

Payload:

If its product's:

<Products>
    <Product>
        <ProductID>P1001</ProductID>
        <ProductName>Wireless Mouse</ProductName>
        <Category>Electronics</Category>
        <Price>25.99</Price>
        <Currency>USD</Currency>
        <StockQuantity>150</StockQuantity>
        <UnitOfMeasure>EA</UnitOfMeasure>
        <Supplier>LogiTech Inc.</Supplier>
    </Product>
 </Products>

If it's suppliers :

<Suppliers>
    <Supplier>
        <ID>P1001</ID>
        <Name>Wireless Mouse</Name>
        <Category>Electronics</Category>
        <Price>27.99</Price>
        <Currency>USD</Currency>
        <StockQuantity>200</StockQuantity>
        <UnitOfMeasure>EA</UnitOfMeasure>
        <Supplier>LogiTech Inc.</Supplier>
    </Supplier>
</Suppliers>

Step-2: Implementing layer-1-Routing layer:

1.start with HTTPS sender adapter

2.Add the Groovy Script to separate the target 2nd layer

Here is the groovy code :

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message
import groovy.util.XmlSlurper

Message processData(Message message) {
    def body = message.getBody(String) // Get XML as a string
    def xml = new XmlSlurper().parseText(body) // Parse XML

    def targetRoute = ""

    // Check the root element or a specific tag (adjust as needed)
    if (xml.name() == "Products") {
        targetRoute = "publisher_solace_inbound_products_layer-2"
    } else if (xml.name() == "Suppliers") {
        targetRoute = "publisher_solace_inbound_suppliers_layer_2"
    } else {
        targetRoute = "publisher_solace_inbound_books_layer_2"
    }

    message.setProperty("routeTo", targetRoute) // Store the route in a property
    return message
}

Implementation: This is the Routing layer paste the groovy code that i given above .

Implement the Exception Handling like the below

Declare the content modifier like below add Exchange properties like below

Add the routing condition to separate whether it is recoverable/non-recoverable errors

Based the routing condition above implement the Local Integration Process separately this is the Local Integration Process for the retry purpose called by using process call

Implement the content modifier as like the below

Through process direct adapter call the another layers that are global retry layers and jms retry for retry purpose

Based the routing condition above implement the Local Integration Process separately this is the Local Integration Process for the Mail triggering if any Business logic/non-recoverable error occurs called by using process call

Implement the content modifier like the below for mail triggering

Through process direct adapter call the mail triggering iflow

Step-3 : Implementing layer -2: publishing layer :

Here in this layer the data which is coming from the layer 1 is published to the solace queues and in this layer there are multiple layer-2's like products layer2 ,suppliers layer2,books layer2 bases on the first layer the target 2nd layer been hitted.

Implementation:

Configure the Process direct sender adapter that is coming from the layer-1

Configure the Advance Event Mesh adapter to publish the data into the solace queues, before configuring it make sure you had setup the solace credentials in the Security material that i had given in the part-2 of my blog series 

Setup the Exception handling for retry purpose

Implement the Local Integration process for retry purpose  as same as the layer-1 above

Implement the Local Integration process for mail triggering as same like the layer -1 above

 

If you want to know how to implement Error handling using jms please refer my blog .

Link - [ https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/handling-connectivity-and-recoverable-errors-in-sap-cpi-with-jms-queues/ba-p/14137974 ]

I would continue the Subscriber part in the part-5 Stay tuned!!!

entry.title: SAP Integration Suite CodeJam roadshow in India - recap
entry.content:
What an eventful week it was! (No pun intended)..... Together with @ajay_soreng, we did one SAP CodeJam per day - 3 different cities (Mumbai, Hyderabad, and Bengaluru), 5 different locations, 3 different topics (SAP Integration Suite, SAP Build Process Automation, and SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh).

Everything was planned to perfection but I had a mental misstep. I mistakenly thought that there was a visa on arrival when traveling to India when in reality it requires applying for an e-visa. Unfortunately, I only found this when I was doing my check-in - Saturday, exactly 12 hours before my flight, a bit late right? I immediately applied for an e-visa but given that it was a Saturday I had to wait till Monday for a resolution. Don't get me wrong, the e-visa process is really good and fast but you can't expect much when you end up applying for it too late.

The adventure only starts here...I joined the first event remotely, from Madrid. Once I receive the e-visa approval, I had 4.5 hours to catch the next plane leaving Madrid heading to India. The second event, I also joined it remotely, but this time from Abu Dhabi. The plane touched ground at 06:35, after going through security, I immediate started searching for a quiet place to join the 2nd CodeJam of the week. Fortunately, I found one :-). Straight after the event, I boarded a plane to Hyderabad - not kidding, I was walking to the gate as we were wrapping up the event. I closed my laptop a minute before boarding. Finally, I made it to Hyderabad Tuesday night and I was able to join the last three events in-person. I sincerely want to apologise to the attendees of the first two events as I wasn't able to be there in-person but it was great meeting you virtually; also, doing the event remotely would have not been possible if it wasn't for the great help and support from @ajay_soreng and @Shilpa_Shankar - Thanks to you both!

Apart from the physical badges (stickers) that many of the attendees got. All attendees of the different SAP CodeJams will get a special SAP Community badge for attending the events ü™™.

 

Mumbai

In Mumbai we did the Connecting systems and services using SAP Integration Suite CodeJam at Colgate office. Thanks Colgate for hosting!

We recently introduced a new exercise where we interact with Slack and send notifications from Cloud Integration to Slack. It was exciting to see many attendees posting their notifications even after the event finished.

Hyderabad

In Hyderabad it was all about SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh. We ran the Event-driven integrations CodeJam at two different locations. Thanks Mindset and Infosys for hosting the events. I joined the first one remotely from Abu Dhabi and finally in-person for the second event. 

Bengaluru

Last city part of the SAP Integration Suite CodeJam roadshow. At Bengaluru, we ran the new SAP Build: Event-based processes and also the Connecting systems and services with SAP Integration Suite CodeJams at SAP Labs Bengaluru and Mindset Consulting, thanks for hosting. We were fortunate enough to be joined by the entire SAP Developer Advocates team based in India ( @sheenamk, @eshrinivasan, @Rekha_DR, @Shilpa_Shankar), as well as by @acharyaw - PM for SAP Build Process Automation.

 

Food

Last but certainly not least... all the lovely food that we enjoyed as part of the roadshow. Thanks to all the hosts.... the food was amazing everywhere haha.

Lots of lessons learned from the mental misstep and there might be cool things and opportunities coming up thanks to it. Also, this wouldn't have been possible without @ajay_soreng's help organising the events and supporting me while I was remotely - Thanks!

entry.title: How SAP Cloud ALM Revitalised System Operations?
entry.content:
Blog no #38

Introduction:

In this blog, first I would like to first thank all of you for always showing so much of love and support, and your amazing feedback on my SAP Blogs.

As the ALM is going from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM, hence are my blogs.

This blog is all about a story and how an organisation took a journey of digital transformation with help of SAP Cloud ALM.

So it start with a question from one of my previous client in my last organisation.

‚ÄúHow can SAP Cloud ALM help my system‚Äôs operation?‚Äù

This was the exact question a client asked me during a meeting at my previous organization. Simple question‚Äîbut one that hits the very core of IT operations in today‚Äôs SAP landscapes.

I paused.

Should I list down features like a catalog?

Or should I talk about the real value that SAP Cloud ALM brings‚Äîsomething beyond checkboxes and dashboards?

Instead, I replied:

‚ÄúIf used and utilised properly, SAP Cloud ALM can revitalise your system operations.‚Äù

 

That word‚Äîrevitalise‚Äîcaught their attention. And I meant it.

 

 

The Problem: A Ticking Time Bomb

 

 

This customer was constantly firefighting during month-end closures. Long running jobs, job failures were often noticed late, system performance dropped without warning, and integration errors silently piled up in the background.

Most of their issues had symptoms‚Äîbut no visibility.

They had monitoring tools‚Äîbut not actionable insight.

They had alerts‚Äîbut no prioritization.

And their operations team? Overworked and overwhelmed.

The Turning Point: Breathing Life Back Into Operations

 

That‚Äôs when I got the opportunity to show what SAP Cloud ALM could really do when configured with purpose and precision.

Here‚Äôs what we implemented:

 

  • ‚úÖJob & Automation Monitoring: To keep an eye on critical background jobs and get real-time notifications when anything went off-track. Month-end issues? Reduced to a whisper.
  • ‚úÖHealth Monitoring: To detect infrastructure and system degradation before users felt the impact. The system stopped breaking down at peak hours.
  • ‚úÖReal User Monitoring (RUM): Because what‚Äôs more honest than tracking exactly how real users experience the application?
  • ‚úÖPerformance Monitoring: To proactively analyze system performance metrics and trends. No more guessing games.
  • ‚úÖIntegration & Exception Monitoring: To bring visibility into the hidden failures between systems, applications, and interfaces.
  • ‚úÖBusiness Process Monitoring: So the customer could finally look at the big picture‚Äîhow their actual business processes were performing end-to-end.

 

The Result: From Firefighting to Forward-Thinking

Once these capabilities were up and running, the impact was visible:

 

  • üìâFewer escalations.
  • üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Faster root cause identification.
  • üßò‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Peace of mind for operations teams.
  • üìàHigher system reliability and trust across business users.

The customer told me later:

 

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs like we got our weekends back.‚Äù

 

The Takeaway

SAP Cloud ALM is not just another monitoring tool. If implemented thoughtfully, it becomes the nerve center of your operations.

 

What made the difference here wasn‚Äôt just configuration‚Äîit was intention. Knowing why each monitoring tile matters, and how they tie into your operational goals, is what unlocks real value.

 

So next time someone asks, ‚ÄúHow can SAP Cloud ALM help my operations?‚Äù‚Äîyou could answer like I did.

 

But make sure you show them what it truly means to revitalise.

 

Have you experienced a similar transformation with SAP Cloud ALM? Or are you exploring its potential? Drop your thoughts or questions in the comments‚ÄîI‚Äôd love to hear your story.

entry.title: Re: Attach Safety Instructions - Substances to Chemical.
entry.content:
Hello

let us start with:https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/1b3596cc5dd5428d887966a4193ddc29/dad1b9efb2e14143a0d63da5cde05e8d.html?locale=en-US

If you read carefully the online help: this would be my story:

You have a "factory" in which you manage chemicals. This can be (or is) in the most cases more than one chemical

Any of these chemicals have different hazards etc.

You need may be to understand first the purpose of a : "Safety Instruction".

First of: the word "factory" is not a good term. Please think of whatever location you can describe there you manage "chemicals".

The variants of such locations are very big. It can be a "big plant/factory" creating only on chemistry, it can be a location there you product many chemicals of different hazards. You can think if a "lab" (e.g. for R&D purpose, or purpose of "analytics" of chemistry) etc.

By "location" need to mange the "safety instruction" different. The challenge is like this:

Example: If you manage X chemicals you can generate X safety instructions

Or you generate a "high level" safey instruction which is not focusing on the "exact" chemical, but "combine" them

Example: warehouse:

You can write done a "white" and "Black" sitution.

a.) the warehouse is used to always store the same chemicals and this will not change by time

b.) or in the warehouse you can have "all"

in most cases it is more a "grey" like situation.

Now you could think like. I always have 10 chemicals (which are always the same). Therefreo you can prepare 10 safety instructions.

In most of the cases; it is different. a "summerized safety instruction" is generated not focusing on a specific chemical

The situation for an "equipment" could be the same.

BUt here you have so many variants how the people define an "equipment".. 

May be read again: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/1b3596cc5dd5428d887966a4193ddc29/8aaef764387541998ca39e664a436536.html?locale=en-US

Here you will see the variant SAP supports.

With best wishes

C.B.

entry.title: WS533 Error during SD Settlement ‚Äì Tax Code Not Determined
entry.content:
Hello,

When performing the final settlement of a customer condition contract via transaction WB2R_SC, I encounter the following error: WS533 ‚Äì Tax code could not be determined via pricing; check customizing.

Context:

  • Transaction: WB2R_SC

  • Contract type: 25 ‚Äì Customer Condition Contract

  • Action: launching the final settlement

  • Source documents: 3 sales orders

  • Pricing procedure is correctly maintained in the contract

Findings:

  • Both the customer and the material master data contain the relevant tax information

  • The source sales orders include the ZTAX condition, which is calculated correctly

  • The error occurs only during the final settlement

  • No lines are generated in the settlement document

Question:
Has anyone faced this issue in a similar scenario? Any ideas on how to fix or bypass this issue?

Thanks in advance for your support!

entry.title: How to Get Remaining Balance for Specific Line Item of an Invoice or Advance
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I‚Äôm trying to get a report in SAP that shows the remaining balance against a particular line item of an invoice or advance payment.

I have already tried the following:

  • J3RFPCR ‚Äì This only shows the original payment document for Special G/L indicator ‚ÄòA‚Äô (Down Payments) but not for other types of transactions.

  • S_ALR_87012105 ‚Äì This doesn‚Äôt provide the line-item level remaining balance information I‚Äôm looking for.

üëâ Internally, the system is working correctly ‚Äì when I run F-53 (Post Outgoing Payment), SAP perfectly shows how much balance is left against that line item and how much I have already adjusted. But I need a report or transaction to view this information directly without going into F-53.

What I need is:

‚úÖ A standard report or method to get the remaining open amount for each line item in an invoice/advance (not just at header level).
‚úÖ Ability to see it for all Special G/L indicators, not just for ‚ÄòA‚Äô.

Is there any:

  • Standard report or transaction code?

  • Table combination or query that can achieve this?

  • Or do I need to go for a custom report? - I have tried table level but didn't get it, BSE_CLR, BSEG

Any suggestions or best practices would be highly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Automatic Profitability Segment Derivation in "Post General Journal Entries" App
entry.content:
Is there any way in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition to automatically derive a profitability segment when posting via the Post General Journal Entries app?

Currently, even when we define custom substitution/validation rules, the system requires us to first manually press "Assign Profitability Segment", and only after that, upon entering the required prerequisite values, the system performs the derivation via the "Derive" button.

Is there any way to bypass this manual process and have the system:

  • automatically derive the profitability segment,

  • without needing to manually assign and trigger derivation?

We are looking for a way to have profitability segments derived seamlessly as part of the journal entry process.
